intro: Lycoseris eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' lycoperdin, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like structure. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lycoseris eggersii is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing in rocky soils and open habitats. Its botanical features include hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves adapted to conserve water in dry conditions.
